review: I first bought the Fire TV and was very impressed with the experience. The number of apps were limited, but it had just enough to do what I needed it to do. Then the stick goes on pre-order for $20. Not a bad deal for something I already enjoyed using. As far as I could tell, it was just a smaller, less powerful version of the Fire TV. Well, it is but it doesn't hold a candle to its older sibling! My son was a little bummed out to find that Minecraft would not install on the device and one of the apps I use for accessing media via DLNA fails miserably. For streaming Netflix and Amazon Prime, it is very good. But other than that, it isn't worth your attention. I would just buy the Fire TV. If you have tried neither and you are in the market, buy the Fire TV.Update: 12/15/2014 (3 weeks of sporadic use)I've been experiencing buffering issues for a while, but now I can't watch anything without it buffering every 10 seconds. I'm only 20 feet from my DIR-868L 802.11ac router and it buffers horribly! However, 40 feet away and several wall obstructions, I am able to stream just fine with my Fire TV! My final verdict is that the product is not worth the money and you should stay clear of it at cost!! I will be throwing it in a drawer and chalking it up as a mistake.

review: You cannot just plug this device into the HDMI port and go.  I had to reset it several times before it would show me any networks.  I followed all the directions.  Then, once it finally connects to the internet/WIFI, it has to download the latest software.  Seriously?!  It's brand new.  How many software updates are availabe already?  At any rate, I've been at it for 35 minutes now and still haven't gotten past the software that is still updating and downloading.  I gave it two stars only because right now, I don't like it.  I may change my mind once I can finally use it.

review: I bought 2 of these because it states it supports Miracast (the ability to throw or "project" your PC to the Fire TV stick).  It just won't work between Fire TV Stick and my Lenovo Windows 8.1.  I didnt realize the Roku3 supported this as of October 2014.  It works perfectly on the Roku3, does not work at all Fire TV Stick.Not sure if I will return it.  After using the Fire TV stick for 2 day i would recommend the Roku3 over this product.  It simply has a better interface and the functionality is superior.
